issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Here's the Jenkins output for the instances sequence (failing to locate the images menu item for some reason)...

{code}

Typing text '
' into field by id = 'resource-menuitem-dashboard'
Executing wait_for_visible_by_css('#item-dropdown_key-pairs+div+div>a'), timeout_in_seconds is set to 60

Executing click_element_by_css('#item-dropdown_key-pairs+div+div>a')

fields.summary: Selenium test sequences experience non-deterministic failures

comments.body:
When I run the snapshots sequence locally, I'm observing the following failure...

{code}
Clicking on element by css = ('#resource-menuitem-images')
Executing wait_for_text_present_by_id id = 'pagetitle', text = 'Images'
Verified text Images present in element by id = pagetitle
Executing wait_for_visible_by_id('refresh-btn'), timeout_in_seconds is set to 60
Element by id = 'refresh-btn' was located in DOM and is visible.
Executing wait_for_visible_by_css('[data-dropdown='item-dropdown_emi-e4723298']'), timeout_in_seconds is set to 60
ERROR: Timed out: element by css = '[data-dropdown='item-dropdown_emi-e4723298']' not visible.
Checking whether element by css = '[data-dropdown='item-dropdown_emi-e4723298']' present in the DOM.
ERROR: Element by css = '[data-dropdown='item-dropdown_emi-e4723298']' not found in the DOM.
Executing click_element_by_css('[data-dropdown='item-dropdown_emi-e4723298']')
ERROR: Could not perform click on element by css = ('[data-dropdown='item-dropdown_emi-e4723298']')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tests/snapshots.py", line 63, in <module>
    Snapshot_operations_sequence.snapshot_ops_test(tester)
  File "tests/snapshots.py", line 39, in snapshot_ops_test
    self.tester.remove_image_from_cloud_on_images_lp(image1_id)
  File "/Users/kgill/CodeRepos/Eucalyptus/eucaconsole/tests/selenium/guiops/guitester/guiec2.py", line 701, in remove_image_from_cloud_on_images_lp
    ImageLanding(self).click_action_remove_image_from_cloud(image_id)
  File "/Users/kgill/CodeRepos/Eucalyptus/eucaconsole/tests/selenium/guiops/pages/image/image_lp.py", line 33, in click_action_remove_image_from_cloud
    self.tester.click_element_by_css(self._image_action_menu_css.format(image_id))
  File "/Users/kgill/CodeRepos/Eucalyptus/eucaconsole/tests/selenium/guiops/selenium_api/selenium_api.py", line 311, in click_element_by_css
    self.driver.find_element_by_css_selector(css).click()
  File "/Users/kgill/Envs/eucaconsole/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 402, in find_element_by_css_selector
    return self.find_element(by=By.CSS_SELECTOR, value=css_selector)
  File "/Users/kgill/Envs/eucaconsole/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 712, in find_element
    {'using': by, 'value': value})['value']
  File "/Users/kgill/Envs/eucaconsole/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 201, in execute
    self.error_handler.check_response(response)
  File "/Users/kgill/Envs/eucaconsole/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/errorhandler.py", line 181, in check_response
    raise exception_class(message, screen, stacktrace)
selenium.common.exceptions.NoSuchElementException: Message: Unable to locate element: {"method":"css selector","selector":"[data-dropdown='item-dropdown_emi-e4723298']"}
Stacktrace:
    at FirefoxDriver.prototype.findElementInternal_ (file:///var/folders/6x/tzmrcwhd0dx9kv41qwlm0pl00000gn/T/tmpGuaZEL/extensions/fxdriver@googlecode.com/components/driver-component.js:10659)
    at fxdriver.Timer.prototype.setTimeout/<.notify (file:///var/folders/6x/tzmrcwhd0dx9kv41qwlm0pl00000gn/T/tmpGuaZEL/extensions/fxdriver@googlecode.com/components/driver-component.js:621)
{code}

Similar errors have been reported by selenium users and the culprit most likely is this selenium bug: https://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=6955

[~kgill] agrees that the best course of action in order to improve test stability is to try to move away from Firefox in CI. I will be testing out running the CI sequence with Chrome driver. I started work on configuring a Crome webdriver.
Thanks [~alice] and [~kgill] for working so hard on this nightmare. You guys are rock stars.

[~kgill] We determined that it was a scale-test that was putting an extreme churn on Jenkins and QA cloud, generating extreme traffic on NCs, and hogging memory and swap. We came up with a solution to avoid memory problems on NC that runs the GUI worker:  we changed configuration in QA cloud so that from now on the NC running the GUI worker will be able to run only one instance (GUI worker) and thus other slaves will not be able to hog memory and swap space on that NC.

We determined that the overloaded Jenkins VM is the likely culprit behind the CI failures ind instability. 
We base our findings on churn tests performed in Micro-QA and on a MAC locally, where the tests ran with excellent stability.

We are currently pursuing several possible workarounds:

1) Increase instance size on QA Jenkins VM to match the increased load.

2) Move CI to Micro-QA: we are currently running into a bug in git plugin, I am working on updating the scripts with a workaround to avoid using the plug-in. 

3) Long term goal: Move CI to a Jenkins installed on a physical server, use a package install. I am currently working on the scripts.
New Jenkins for GUI CI is in place.
